products.name: T-Shirt
products.CO2-emissions: High due to water-intensive cotton farming.
products.Ingredients: Cotton (often sprayed with pesticides), dyes (some synthetic and harmful to the environment).
products.Production-method: Large-scale farming, often involving child labor and harmful chemicals.
products.Coloring: Synthetic dyes, some of which can be toxic to water bodies.
products.Packaging: Usually plastic bags or cardboard boxes, both contributing to waste.

products.name: Smartphone
products.CO2-emissions: High due to the complex manufacturing process and the use of rare earth metals.
products.Ingredients: Metals (e.g., aluminum, copper, lithium), plastics, glass.
products.Production-method: Energy-intensive assembly in factories, often with poor working conditions.
products.Coloring: Primarily metallic finishes, sometimes involving harmful chemicals.
products.Packaging: Cardboard boxes, plastic components, and styrofoam inserts.

products.name: Beef Steak
products.CO2-emissions: Extremely high due to methane emissions from cattle and deforestation for grazing.
products.Ingredients: Beef, often from animals raised in intensive farming conditions.
products.Production-method: Large-scale cattle ranching, often involving deforestation and unsustainable practices.
products.Packaging: Usually plastic trays or foam containers.

products.name: Palm Oil-Based Products
products.CO2-emissions: High due to deforestation for palm oil plantations.
products.Ingredients: Palm oil, used in many processed foods and cosmetics.
products.Production-method: Large-scale plantations, often leading to deforestation and habitat destruction.
products.Packaging: Varies depending on the product, but often includes plastic and cardboard.

products.name: Paper Products (e.g., Notebooks, Tissue)
products.CO2-emissions: Moderate, depending on the source of the wood.
products.Ingredients: Wood pulp, often from managed forests.
products.Production-method: Pulping and papermaking, which can involve the use of chemicals.
products.Coloring: Dyes and pigments, some of which can be harmful to the environment.
products.Packaging: Often cardboard boxes or plastic bags.

products.name: Fast Fashion Clothing
products.CO2-emissions: High due to the rapid production cycle and use of synthetic materials.
products.Ingredients: Synthetic fabrics (e.g., polyester, nylon), often from fossil fuels.
products.Production-method: Low-cost manufacturing, often with poor working conditions and environmental practices.
products.Coloring: Synthetic dyes, some of which can be toxic to water bodies.

products.name: Processed Foods
products.CO2-emissions: Varies depending on the ingredients and production methods.
products.Ingredients: A variety of ingredients, often processed and packaged.
products.Production-method: Industrial food processing, often involving energy-intensive processes.
products.Coloring: Artificial colors, some of which can be harmful to health.
products.Packaging: Plastic bags, boxes, and other packaging materials.

products.name: Electronics (e.g., TVs, Computers)
products.CO2-emissions: High due to the complex manufacturing process and the use of rare earth metals.
products.Production-method: Energy-intensive assembly in factories, often with poor working conditions.
products.Coloring: Primarily metallic finishes, sometimes involving harmful chemicals.
products.Packaging: Cardboard boxes, plastic components, and styrofoam inserts.

products.name: Plastic Bottles
products.CO2-emissions: Moderate due to the production process and transportation.
products.Production-method: Chemical process to produce plastic, often using fossil fuels.
products.Coloring: Pigments, some of which can be harmful to the environment.

products.name: Fish Products (e.g., Canned Tuna)
products.CO2-emissions: Moderate to high, depending on fishing practices and transportation.
products.Ingredients: Fish, often caught using unsustainable methods.
products.Production-method: Fishing and processing, which can have negative impacts on marine ecosystems.
